search_results.snippet:
a cappella Music for voices alone, without instrumental accompaniment. ... The 
term derives from the early practice of singing psalms "antiphonally"- that is, with 
two ... ballata A type of fourteenth-century italian secular song, similar to the 
French virelai. .... The most common duple meters have two or four beats per 
measure.
search_results.title: Glossary for Music Appreciation

question: This Italian term describes music that has no instrumental accompaniment
